page.title: 02EDUCATION LEADENHAM
page.content: Situated in the middle of the Village just north of crossroads.A stone building erected in 1857.Two main classrooms and a small room used chiefly as dining room.Cloak room block added more recently.A Church Aided School with two full time teachers.In July 1985,36 children on roll.Headteacher teaches juniors (8-11yrs),Assistant teaches infants (5-8yrs),Staff appointed by Board of Governors,increased in Sept.1985 by 8 members to 14.Village Priest is Chairman and takes weekly assemblies. Subjects taught include mathematics,written and spoken english,religious education,science, history,geography,art & craft,physical education.Computer first used in 1984. Friends of School Assn.Non teaching staff are caretaker,dinner supervisor, part time secretary and groundsmen.
